intro: Lophanthus schtschurowskianus var. kulabensis, commonly known as the Kulabense Lophanthus, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences, and the leaves are usually lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
